title: A Song of Ice and Fire
description: An epic tale of politics, war, and dragons in the land of Westeros.
author: George R. R. Martin

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: A journey through Middle-earth to destroy the One Ring.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

description: A chilling depiction of a totalitarian regime and its impact on society.
author: George Orwell

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A powerful story about justice and racial inequality in the American South.
author: Harper Lee

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A tale of love, wealth, and tragedy in the Jazz Age.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: The journey of a disillusioned teenager through New York City.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic world where individuality is suppressed in favor of stability.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Moby-Dick
description: The tale of a captain's obsession with hunting a white whale.
author: Herman Melville

title: The Hobbit
description: A prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo's journey to the Lonely Mountain.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A classic tale of love and societal expectations in Regency-era England.
author: Jane Austen
